thread.title: Wheat Kings rise to third in CHL rankings
thread.title_full: Wheat Kings rise to third in CHL rankings

title: Wheat Kings rise to third in CHL rankings
text:
By: Enlarge Image 
Tanner Kaspick (FILE PHOTO) 
THE WEEK THAT WAS: The Brandon Wheat Kings played two games last week, beating the Swift Current Broncos 5-3 at home on Friday and then beginning their eight-game road trip with a 4-1 win on Saturday in Saskatoon against the Blades. 
EXPLANATION: All statistics in today’s column were compiled before the Wheat Kings played the Spokane Chiefs late on Wednesday evening. 
ROSTER CHANGES: D James Shearer of Brandon was added to the roster and D Dominic Thom was reassigned to the Alberta Junior Hockey League last week. 
SICK BAY: Forwards Ty Lewis and Tim McGauley both remain out week-to-week with upper-body injuries. Neither made the two-week West Coast trip with the team. 
STREAKS: Tanner Kaspick and new captain Macoy Erkamps both went into Wednesday’s games with goals in four straight games, while Jayce Hawryluk and Reid Duke had six-game point streaks on the go. The season-high point-scoring streak in the Western Hockey League this season is held by Simon Stransky of the Prince Albert Raiders and rookie Michael Spacek of the Red Deer Rebels, who both had 10-game streaks snapped last Friday. 
RANKINGS: Brandon rose to third in the Canadian Hockey League rankings this week, up from their season-worst ranking of sixth last week. The unbeaten Erie Otters of the Ontario Hockey League remain on top. The other WHL teams in the rankings are the Moose Jaw Warriors (sixth), Seattle Thunderbirds (eighth) and Prince Albert Raiders (10th). 
ROAD WARRIORS: When the Wheat Kings left Saskatoon on Saturday, they were 3-0-0-0 on the road this season. 
PRODUCTION BY PERIOD: The Wheat Kings had scored 16 goals in the first period of the nine games they played prior to Wednesday, with 15 goals scored in each the second and third periods. They gave up four in the first period and six in each the second and third periods. 
TAKING THEIR SHOT: The Wheat Kings have taken 132 shots in the first and second periods this season and 129 in the third, which is remarkably consistent. Overall, they have outshot their opponents 401-210, averaging 44.56 shots per game. They had yet to be outshot this season. 
’t scored 26 goals. 
The Brandon Sun
